title.native: すべてがFになる THE PERFECT INSIDER
title.romaji: Subete ga F ni Naru: THE PERFECT INSIDER

description:
The story of the original Subete ga F ni Naru novel revolves around Souhei Saikawa, a member of the Saikawa Research Lab. He goes on a vacation held by the lab, and Moe Nishinosono, the daughter of his mentor, joins the group on their vacation despite not being a part of the lab. There, the two end up finding a corpse. The two work together to solve the mysteries of what becomes a serial murder case.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Everything Becomes F: The Perfect Insider

title.native: すべてがFになる
すべてがFになる -THE PERFECT INSIDER-

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asano_inio) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asano_inio/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUISMkOhQ2Em1uhXO7uIN8g)

A Japanese manga author. Asano created [Oyasumi Punpun](https://anilist.co/manga/34632/Goodnight-Punpun/), [Umibe no Onnanoko](https://anilist.co/manga/47353/A-Girl-on-the-Shore/), [Yuushatachi](https://anilist.co/manga/86217/Yuushatachi/) and the acclaimed manga [Solanin](https://anilist.co/manga/33731), which was released as a feature film in Japan in April 2010, starring [Aoi Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96055/Aoi-Miyazaki). Known for creating character-driven, realist stories, ranging from slice of life to psychological horror, Asano won first prize in the 2001 GX competition for young manga artists. In 2010, The Yomiuri Shimbun described Asano as "one of the voices of his generation."

He was previously married to the mangaka [Akane Torikai](https://anilist.co/staff/124465/Akane-Torikai).

__Notable work outside Manga:__

- No More Heroes III (Video Game, 2021) (NT Kamui Character Design)

After graduating from Miyakojima Technical Senior High School, Kanbe moved to Tokyo and went to a Professional Training College while delivering newspapers to maintain himself. He joined Studio [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/Topcraft) and as his first job he worked as production assistant on [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/Nausica-of-the-Valley-of-the-Wind/).

In the late '80s and early '90s he worked on several NHK educational anime for children while he had his debut as director with the OVA [Ninja Ryuukenden](https://anilist.co/anime/619/Ninja-Ryuukenden/) in 1991. 

In 1997 he established Studio Garan with several employees of [Studio Junio](https://anilist.co/studio/280/Studio-Junio) (which he had previously joined). Garan was one of the subcontracting studios for [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/Cardcaptor-Sakura/) and the episodes Kanbe directed garnered much attention. He left Garan in 2000.

More recently he's been mainly known for directing psychological and thriller anime like [Elfen Lied](https://anilist.co/anime/226/Elfen-Lied/), [Electromagnetic Girlfriend](https://anilist.co/anime/5177/Electromagnetic-Girlfriend/) and [The Promised Neverland](https://anilist.co/anime/101759/The-Promised-Neverland/).

[Website](http://www.kenjikawai.com/index_e.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E4%BA%95%E6%86%B2%E6%AC%A1)

After dropping out of a nuclear engineering program at Tokai University, Kawai Kenji began studying music at Shobi Music Academy. However, he dropped out after half a year. With a few friends, he created the band Muse, playing fusion rock and participating in music competitions. Through competing in such contests, the band members became technically competent to enter the music industry and decided to part ways.

After leaving Muse, Kawai Kenji began composing music for commercials in his home studio. While recording music for [Yuji Mitsuya](https://anilist.co/staff/95874/) he met music director Naoko Asari, who advised him to compose anime soundtracks. Some of his most famous anime soundtracks can be found in [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1288/), [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), [Fate/Stay Night](https://anilist.co/anime/356/), [When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/) and more recently in [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/).

He has worked on several projects with the director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/) and has written scores for all of Hideo Nakata's films. Kenji Kawai's music has received the Annie award and Hong Kong Film Award in 2005, for [Ghost in The Shell 2: Innocence](https://anilist.co/anime/468/) he was nominated for an Annie award.

Following his success as an anime music composer, he became involved in live action movies. He contributed music to horror films: Ring, Ring 2, Dark Water, Japanese-Polish science-fiction film Avalon and the Hong Kong film Seven Swords.

For the music found in Seven Swords and A Battle of Wits he was nominated for Best Original Film Score Awards at both the 25th and 26th Hong Kong Film Awards in 2006 and 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

__Members:__
- Maguro Taniguchi (lead vocals, rhythm guitar) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonmaguro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/taniguchi_maguro)
- Hayato Koga (lead guitar, backing vocals) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboontuna) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboontuna)
- Takahiro Koizumi (drums) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonkoicha)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboon_official_insta) |  [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kanaboon) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/KANABOONVEVO/) | [Official Website](https://sp.kanaboon.jp/) 

A Japanese rock band formed in 2008, currently associated with Ki/oon Music. They've had four albums reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Albums Chart. They have also had five singles reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Singles Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Johann Sebastian Bach was a German composer, organist, harpsichordist, violist, and violinist whose sacred and secular works for choir, orchestra, and solo instruments drew together the strands of the Baroque period and brought it to its ultimate maturity.    

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Website](https://www.scenarioart.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/scenarioart) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Scenarioart) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/scenarioart_official/)

__Members:__
• Kumiko Hatto (ハットリクミコ, Hatto Kumiko), drums, vocals
• Takahisa Yamashita (ヤマシタタカヒサ, Yamashita Takahisa), bass, chorus
• Kōsuke Hayashi (ハヤシコウスケ, Hayashi Kōsuke), guitar, vocals

**Tomonori Ochikoshi** is a Japanese producer. He is affiliated with studio A-1 Pictures.
He also draws under the pen name: Jason    Games he worked on:  - Final Fantasy IX (2000), Square Co., Ltd.  - Parasite Eve (1998), Square Co., Ltd.  - Bahamut Lagoon (1996), Square Co., Ltd.
